page.title: 16Tumrose Farm.
page.content: Mr. Larsen farms about 200 acres at Blisland. He has an 80 cow suckler herd, half of the herd calving in Autumn the other half in the Spring. The cows go to a Charolais bull and the heifers are artificially insemenated by a Blonde D'Aquitaine bull. This gives smaller calves at birth and easier calving. The young stock are reared for about eighteen months. Mr. Larsen sells them at Holsworhy cattle market and expects to get about Â£500 each for them. The cattle are kept indoors in Winter and fed on hay and silage.This keeps the animals in good condition and prevents them poaching or damaging the land with their feet. Mr. Larsen keeps a flock of 100 ewes and hopes to get 150 to 200 lambs each year.
